Animal Class Reference

Basic Animal class, holds all fields and methods common to Predators and Prey. More...

#include <Animal.h>

Protected Member Functions

void setupNodeHeirarchy ()
 Setup the node heirarchy. This will be the same for both Predators and Prey so it is implemented in this class. This method also regesters the Animal to receive updates from the SceneManager.
void destroyNodeHeirarchy ()
 Destroy the node heirarchy used by the animal. This should be called in the deconstructor of Predator and Prey. This also makes sure to remove the Animal from the SceneManager's update listeners.
void updatePointer ()
 Update method called by subclasses in their own update method. This has nothing to do with the actual simulation which is why it is hidden away.

Protected Attributes

std::string name
 Name of the Animal, this should be set in the Constructor of any subclasses.
std::string species
 Species of the animal.
BehaviorState currentBehavior
 The current behavioral state of the Animal.
double sightAngle
 The angle of vision of the animal. ex. A sight angle of 70 would correspond to the animal being able to see 35 degrees left and right of the direction its facing.
double sightDistance
 How far the animal can see, 1 unit = 1 pixel.
double hearingDistance
 How far the animal can effectively hear.
double stealth
 Stealth factor of the Animal. This affects when other Animals can hear the Animal and should be clamped between 0 and 1.
double camoflauge
 Stealth factor of the Animal. This affects when other Animals can see the Animal and should be clamped between 0 and 1.
double weight
 This is the weight of the animal (in pounds) and affects how a predator will react to a prey and vice versa. An elephant won't run from a dog, and a dog won't attack an elephant. It is clamped from 0 to 20000.
double baseSpeed
 The base speed of the Animal. This is modified by the behaviors.
SceneNode * mainNode
 Main SceneNode representing the Animal's position and orientation.
SceneNode * pointerNode
 SceneNode that is attached to the Camera's node and is used to point at mainNode when the Animal is offscreen.

Detailed Description

Basic Animal class, holds all fields and methods common to Predators and Prey.

Member Function Documentation

void Animal::constructRenderables ( const std::string &  spriteName,
const std::string &  pointerSpriteName,
const hgeColor &  hearingColor,
const hgeColor &  sightColor 
)

Construct the renderables used.

Parameters:
spriteName The name of the sprite to use to render the Animal. The sprite's size should reflect the animal's weight, but it doesn't have to.
pointerSpriteName The name of the sprite to use for the pointer.
hearingColor The color to be used for the circle representing the hearing range of an animal.
sightColor The color used for the line of sight triangle.
Remarks:
This should be the last step performed by an Environment when creating a Predator or Prey and should be called after all other properties have been set.

Definition at line 60 of file Animal.cpp.

void Animal::destroyNodeHeirarchy (  )  [protected]

Destroy the node heirarchy used by the animal. This should be called in the deconstructor of Predator and Prey. This also makes sure to remove the Animal from the SceneManager's update listeners.

Definition at line 186 of file Animal.h.

virtual void Animal::move ( const double &  factor  )  [pure virtual]

Move the Animal.

Parameters:
factor The amount by which to modify the base speed, should be greater than 0. Negative values will move the Animal backwards.

Implemented in Predator, and Prey.

virtual void Animal::setBehaviorFamily ( const std::string &  family  )  [pure virtual]

Set the behavior family to be used by the Animal.

Parameters:
family The BehaviorFamily to use.

Implemented in Predator, and Prey.

virtual void Animal::setBehaviorState ( const BehaviorState &  state  )  [pure virtual]

Set the currently active behavioral state.

Parameters:
state The state for theAnimal to use.
Remarks:
This method should only be called by the PredatorBehavior and PreyBehavior classes during their update cycle.

Implemented in Predator, and Prey.

void Animal::setCamoflauge ( const double &  camo  )  [inline]

Set how well camoflauged the Animal is.

This affects the distance at which another Animal can see the Animal.

Parameters:
camo How well camoflauged the Animal is.
Remarks:
This value is clamped from 0 to 1. A value of 0 means the Animal will be detected as soon as it enters another Animal's sight range and a value of 1 means that it will not be seen at all.

Parameters:
angle The heading of the Animal in degrees.

Definition at line 40 of file Animal.cpp.

void Animal::setSightAngle ( double  angle  )  [inline]

Set the sight cone angle of the Animal.

Parameters:
angle The angle in degrees.
Remarks:
This angle will be split in half to represent how well the Animal can see things to its left and right.

Definition at line 96 of file Animal.h.

Parameters:
distance How far, in screen units, that the Animal can see.

Definition at line 112 of file Animal.h.

void Animal::setSpeed ( double  speed  )  [inline]

Set the speed of the Animal.

Parameters:
speed How far the animal moves in a second.
Remarks:
This value should be greater than 0.

Definition at line 192 of file Animal.h.

void Animal::setStealth ( const double &  stealth  )  [inline]

Set how stealthy the Animal is.

This affects the distance at which another Animal can hear the animal.

Parameters:
stealth How stealthy this Animal is.
Remarks:
This value is clamped from 0 to 1. A value of 0 means the Animal will be detected as soon as it enters another Animal's hearing range and a value of 1 means that it will not be heard at all.

Definition at line 140 of file Animal.h.

void Animal::setupNodeHeirarchy (  )  [protected]

Setup the node heirarchy. This will be the same for both Predators and Prey so it is implemented in this class. This method also regesters the Animal to receive updates from the SceneManager.

void Animal::setWeight ( double  weight  )  [inline]

Set the weight of the Animal The weight of an Animal affects how predators react to the Animal.

Parameters:
weight How heavy the Animal is.
Remarks:
This value is clamped from 0 to 20000.
